document_title: Sphenoid sinusitis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
When patients present with atypical headaches, doctors can conduct laboratory testing to diagnose sphenoid sinusitis to avoid serious complications.
Techniques commonly performed to diagnose sphenoid sinusitis include:
1. Nasal endoscopy
Nasal endoscopy is an important diagnostic tool for paranasal sinus diseases. However, findings in patients with isolated sphenoid sinus disease may be unclear.
2. CT scan
CT scanning is an important tool in diagnosing patients with suspected sphenoid sinus disease. Often, isolated sphenoid sinus disease is an incidental finding during radiological workup for atypical headaches.
CT scan diagnoses sphenoid sinusitis. Photo: Tam Anh Hospital
